think about the the campaign that Powell has maintained it's been very communicative very steady and it's been very slow and methodical like very slow we even been waiting so long to cut rates where a lot of people have been arguing this should have started like six months ago at at the at the late end so it would be actually kind of surprising to me to see Powell go through his real real focus on controlling inflation his fear of inflation spiking back up once we start cutting rates cuz that's a whole other problem set and to start with a 50 basis point cut actually to me would start to indicate that they don't feel like they have the same Runway that they've been communicating because that's one of the luxuries they've had about the rate they've been able to move so slowly and methodically because things aren't breaking all over the place yet we've been very economically resilient we've seen some spikes some drops in things like employment productivity metrics stuff like that but we're not seeing like depression level signals or anything like that so I am now really really eager actually to see if this materializes because I could see this going either way again I would imagine in terms of price we would see near-term positive price movement but I imagine we would see sentiment change a little bit and people starting to get a little bit kind of curious about we've had
